(ENG) √†ngels barcelona is pleased to present "Series", the 1st solo show in Spain of artist Suzanne Lafont (b. 1949, N√Æmes) whose body of work is an extended practice of photography which incorporates references to theatre, performance, cinema, literature, art history and contemporary culture. 
"Series" presents 2 of her key works through which we discover her interest in subjectivity, the making of meaning and appropriationism as a strategy used by conceptual art. On the one hand, "Situation Comedy" (2010), an installation with which Lafont takes as its starting point  the work "Manipulating the Self: A Borderline Case" (1971) by the Canadian art group General Idea, in which artists compiled 115 photographs, which were sent to them by different people, in response to the following instructions: ‚ÄúThe hand is a mirror for the mind - wrap your arm over your head, lodging your elbow behind and grabbing your chin with your hand.‚Äù. On the other, "Index" (1987-2015), a double-projection showing a series of images of different objects , and everyday scenes, which are associated with words and are arranged alphabetically in order to form a kind of dictionary. The new and unexpected regrouping of the world, as portrayed in Index,  breaks with the familiar patterns of thinking by using an experimental and playful redistribution of meanings

Por un lado, "Situation Comedy" (2010), una instalaci√≥n con la que Lafont toma como punto de partida la obra ‚ÄúManipulating the Self: A Borderline Case‚Äù(1971) del colectivo art√≠stico canadiense General Idea. En esta pieza de mail art los artistas recopilaban 115 fotograf√≠as, que les fueron enviadas por diferentes personas, como respuesta a las siguientes instrucciones: "La mano es un espejo para la mente: envuelva su brazo sobre su cabeza, dejando su codo hacia atr√°s y tomando su barbilla con la mano". Por otro, "Index" (1987-2015), una doble proyecci√≥n que muestra una serie de im√°genes de diferentes objetos y escenas cotidianas, asociadas con palabras en ingl√©s y franc√©s y ordenadas alfab√©ticamente formando una especie de diccionario. La nueva e inesperada reagrupaci√≥n del mundo, tal y como se muestra en Index, rompe con los patrones tradicionales de nuestra manera de pensar utiliza una nueva distribuci√≥n de significados que resulta experimental y l√∫dica
